intro: Tephrosia aurantiaca subsp. hirsutostylosa, commonly known as the hairy-styled yellow tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant is distinguished by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The species is noted for its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
